how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, my TiddlyWiki is for personal use only
putting it all together, what value does: Keeping a record of my work and life, in a single HTML file, with hyperlinked pages, subjects, etc.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism);Single-file wiki third-party mobile app (e.g. Tiddloid, Quine)

what are we doing well? prompts for thin: A full-featured wiki system in a single-HTML file. That's extremely useful. And easy to use on top of that.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: I could leave TiddlyWiki if out of nowhere appeared another project that works better. A calendar-like thing for journal entries would be helpful. I also think the documentation could be improved, taking into account persons of different expertise levels, and what they intend to achieve, following for example the Di√°taxis approach to documentation. There are a few things I'd like to do/change myself on my wikis, but I have no idea where to begin.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
